description: Mali, a former French colony in West Africa, has been fighting an Islamist insurgency for the past three years.
title: What We Know and Don’t Know About the Terrorist Attack in Mali
title_page: What We Know and Don’t Know About the Terrorist Attack in Mali - The New York Times
text:
Gunmen seized a hotel in Bamako, the capital of Mali, on Friday, taking about 100 people hostage and killing more than two dozen. The attack is the latest eruption of violence in Mali, a former French colony in West Africa that has been racked by an Islamist insurgency for the past three years.
What Is the Situation in Mali?
In 2012, a military coup overthrew the democratically elected president, destabilizing what had been one of the most secure, albeit poor, nations in the region.
